meanings.definition: The quality or state of being funny.
meanings.sent1: Her jokes always bring a lot of funninesses to our gatherings.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's performance was filled with funninesses that had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent3: The funninesses of the situation made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His natural funninesses shone through even in serious conversations.
meanings.sent5: The movie's funninesses lingered in the minds of the viewers long after it ended.

meanings.definition: The amusing or entertaining aspect of something.
meanings.sent1: The funninesses of the cartoon characters always make me smile.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed the play not only for its plot but also for its funninesses.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected funninesses in the story caught us off guard.
meanings.sent4: His witty remarks added an extra layer of funninesses to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The children's book was full of delightful funninesses that captivated young readers.

meanings.definition: The ability to provoke laughter or amusement.
meanings.sent1: Her talent for creating funninesses in her stories is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes had a perfect balance of funninesses and wit.
meanings.sent3: The playful funninesses in his gestures never failed to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: His quick wit and natural funninesses made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: The sitcom's clever funninesses kept viewers coming back for more laughs.
